intro: Gutierrezia fasciculata, commonly known as narrowleaf gorse, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small yellow daisies. The plant produces small, narrow leaves and has a bushy growth habit, often forming dense thickets in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia fasciculata is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
